span.title: MedicinalProductDefinition : A medicinal product, being a substance or combination of substances that is intended to treat, prevent or diagnose a disease, or to restore, correct or modify physiological functions by exerting a pharmacological, immunological or metabolic action. This resource is intended to define and detail such products and their properties, for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, or drug catalogs).

span.title: MedicinalProductDefinition.identifier : Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID. When in development or being regulated, products are typically referenced by official identifiers, assigned by a manufacturer or regulator, and unique to a product (which, when compared to a product instance being prescribed, is actually a product type). See also MedicinalProductDefinition.code.

span.title: MedicinalProductDefinition.combinedPharmaceuticalDoseForm : The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product. This is one concept that describes all the components. It does not represent the form with components physically mixed, if that might be necessary, for which see (AdministrableProductDefinition.administrableDoseForm).

span.title: MedicinalProductDefinition.route : The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. See also AdministrableProductDefinition resource. MedicinalProductDefinition.route is the same concept as AdministrableProductDefinition.routeOfAdministration.code, and they cannot be used together.

span.title: MedicinalProductDefinition.ingredient : The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, or indirectly via incoming AdministrableProductDefinition, PackagedProductDefinition or ManufacturedItemDefinition references. In cases where those levels of detail are not used, the ingredients may be specified directly here as codes.

span.title: MedicinalProductDefinition.code : A code that this product is known by, usually within some formal terminology, perhaps assigned by a third party (i.e. not the manufacturer or regulator). Products (types of medications) tend to be known by identifiers during development and within regulatory process. However when they are prescribed they tend to be identified by codes. The same product may be have multiple codes, applied to it by multiple organizations.

a.title: Legend for this format

publisher.value: Health Level Seven International (Biomedical Research and Regulation)

description.value: Detailed definition of a medicinal product, typically for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, drug catalogs, to support prescribing, adverse events management etc.).

short.value: Detailed definition of a medicinal product

definition.value: A medicinal product, being a substance or combination of substances that is intended to treat, prevent or diagnose a disease, or to restore, correct or modify physiological functions by exerting a pharmacological, immunological or metabolic action. This resource is intended to define and detail such products and their properties, for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, or drug catalogs).

human.value: If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT contain nested Resources
If the resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL be referred to from elsewhere in the resource or SHALL refer to the containing resource

expression.value: contained.where(((id.exists() and ('#'+id in (%resource.descendants().reference | %resource.descendants().as(canonical) | %resource.descendants().as(uri) | %resource.descendants().as(url)))) or descendants().where(reference = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(canonical) = '#').exists() or descendants().where(as(uri) = '#').exists()).not()).trace('unmatched', id).empty()

human.value: If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a meta.versionId or a meta.lastUpdated
If a resource is contained in another resource, it SHALL NOT have a security label

valueMarkdown.value: When a resource has no narrative, only systems that fully understand the data can display the resource to a human safely. Including a human readable representation in the resource makes for a much more robust eco-system and cheaper handling of resources by intermediary systems. Some ecosystems restrict distribution of resources to only those systems that do fully understand the resources, and as a consequence implementers may believe that the narrative is superfluous. However experience shows that such eco-systems often open up to new participants over time.

human.value: A resource should have narrative for robust management

map.value: Medicinal Product and Investigational Medicinal Product

short.value: Logical id of this artifact

definition.value: The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes.

comment.value: The only time that a resource does not have an id is when it is being submitted to the server using a create operation.

short.value: Metadata about the resource

definition.value: The metadata about the resource. This is content that is maintained by the infrastructure. Changes to the content might not always be associated with version changes to the resource.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: A set of rules under which this content was created

definition.value: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content. Often, this is a reference to an implementation guide that defines the special rules along with other profiles etc.

comment.value: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However, the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element. Often, when used, the URL is a reference to an implementation guide that defines these special rules as part of it's narrative along with other profiles, value sets, etc.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

isModifierReason.value: This element is labeled as a modifier because the implicit rules may provide additional knowledge about the resource that modifies it's meaning or interpretation

short.value: Language of the resource content

definition.value: The base language in which the resource is written.

comment.value: Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource. Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: IETF language tag

short.value: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation

definition.value: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource and can be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.

comment.value: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative. In some cases, a resource may only have text with little or no additional discrete data (as long as all minOccurs=1 elements are satisfied). This may be necessary for data from legacy systems where information is captured as a "text blob" or where text is additionally entered raw or narrated and encoded information is added later.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Contained, inline Resources

definition.value: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.

comment.value: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again. Contained resources may have profiles and tags In their meta elements, but SHALL NOT have security labels.

human.value: Containing new R4B resources within R4 resources may cause interoperability issues if instances are shared with R4 systems

short.value: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID

definition.value: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID. When in development or being regulated, products are typically referenced by official identifiers, assigned by a manufacturer or regulator, and unique to a product (which, when compared to a product instance being prescribed, is actually a product type). See also MedicinalProductDefinition.code.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized

definition.value: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Overall defining type of this medicinal product.

map.value: (indicates if this is Medicinal Product or an Investigational Medicinal Product)

short.value: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses

definition.value: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Applicable domain for this product (e.g. human, veterinary).

short.value: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product

definition.value: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product, this is commonly used to support revisions to an existing product.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: The status within the lifecycle of this product record

definition.value: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

isModifierReason.value: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that can indicate that a record should not be treated as valid

description.value: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

short.value: The date at which the given status became applicable

definition.value: The date at which the given status became applicable.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: General description of this product

definition.value: General description of this product.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product

definition.value: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product. This is one concept that describes all the components. It does not represent the form with components physically mixed, if that might be necessary, for which see (AdministrableProductDefinition.administrableDoseForm).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Dose forms for a product as a whole, considering all individual parts, but before any mixing

short.value: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body

definition.value: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. See also AdministrableProductDefinition resource. MedicinalProductDefinition.route is the same concept as AdministrableProductDefinition.routeOfAdministration.code, and they cannot be used together.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a patient's body.

short.value: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required

definition.value: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required. In cases where structured indications are required, they are captured using the ClinicalUseDefinition resource. An indication is a medical situation for which using the product is appropriate.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

map.value: (roll up of all text in Therapeutic Indication.Indication Text, for common case where information is not granular)

short.value: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator

definition.value: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: The prescription supply types appropriate to a medicinal product

map.value: Marketing Authorisation.Legal Status of Supply (moved here for practicality)

short.value: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons

definition.value: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons, such as heightened reporting requirements.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as heightened reporting requirements (e.g. Black Triangle Monitoring).

short.value: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons

definition.value: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorisation studies.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorisation studies.

short.value: If authorised for use in children

definition.value: If authorised for use in children, or infants, neonates etc.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Suitability for age groups, in particular children.

short.value: Allows the product to be classified by various systems

definition.value: Allows the product to be classified by various systems, commonly WHO ATC.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: This value set includes codes from the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System - provided as an exemplar value set.

short.value: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorization

definition.value: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorization. This refers to the product being actually 'on the market' as opposed to being allowed to be on the market (which is an authorization).

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Package type for the product

definition.value: Package type for the product. See also the PackagedProductDefinition resource.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: Types of medicinal product packs

short.value: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources

definition.value: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, or indirectly via incoming AdministrableProductDefinition, PackagedProductDefinition or ManufacturedItemDefinition references. In cases where those levels of detail are not used, the ingredients may be specified directly here as codes.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: This value set includes all substance codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

map.value: Medicinal Product.Ingredient (see also FHIR Ingredient resource)

short.value: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance, or an excipient in the drug product

definition.value: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance, or an excipient in the drug product. This includes process-related impurities and contaminants, product-related impurities including degradation products.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

description.value: This value set includes all substance codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

short.value: Additional documentation about the medicinal product

definition.value: Additional information or supporting documentation about the medicinal product.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File)

definition.value: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File). Drug master files (DMFs) are documents submitted to regulatory agencies to provide confidential detailed information about facilities, processes or articles used in the manufacturing, processing, packaging and storing of drug products.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization

definition.value: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

short.value: Detailed definition of a medicinal product

definition.value: A medicinal product, being a substance or combination of substances that is intended to treat, prevent or diagnose a disease, or to restore, correct or modify physiological functions by exerting a pharmacological, immunological or metabolic action. This resource is intended to define and detail such products and their properties, for uses other than direct patient care (e.g. regulatory use, or drug catalogs).

map.value: Medicinal Product and Investigational Medicinal Product

short.value: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID

definition.value: Business identifier for this product. Could be an MPID. When in development or being regulated, products are typically referenced by official identifiers, assigned by a manufacturer or regulator, and unique to a product (which, when compared to a product instance being prescribed, is actually a product type). See also MedicinalProductDefinition.code.

short.value: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized

definition.value: Regulatory type, e.g. Investigational or Authorized.

description.value: Overall defining type of this medicinal product.

map.value: (indicates if this is Medicinal Product or an Investigational Medicinal Product)

short.value: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses

definition.value: If this medicine applies to human or veterinary uses.

description.value: Applicable domain for this product (e.g. human, veterinary).

short.value: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product

definition.value: A business identifier relating to a specific version of the product, this is commonly used to support revisions to an existing product.

short.value: The status within the lifecycle of this product record

definition.value: The status within the lifecycle of this product record. A high-level status, this is not intended to duplicate details carried elsewhere such as legal status, or authorization status.

isModifierReason.value: This element is labelled as a modifier because it is a status element that can indicate that a record should not be treated as valid

description.value: The lifecycle status of an artifact.

short.value: The date at which the given status became applicable

definition.value: The date at which the given status became applicable.

short.value: General description of this product

definition.value: General description of this product.

short.value: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product

definition.value: The dose form for a single part product, or combined form of a multiple part product. This is one concept that describes all the components. It does not represent the form with components physically mixed, if that might be necessary, for which see (AdministrableProductDefinition.administrableDoseForm).

description.value: Dose forms for a product as a whole, considering all individual parts, but before any mixing

short.value: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body

definition.value: The path by which the product is taken into or makes contact with the body. In some regions this is referred to as the licenced or approved route. See also AdministrableProductDefinition resource. MedicinalProductDefinition.route is the same concept as AdministrableProductDefinition.routeOfAdministration.code, and they cannot be used together.

description.value: A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a patient's body.

short.value: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required

definition.value: Description of indication(s) for this product, used when structured indications are not required. In cases where structured indications are required, they are captured using the ClinicalUseDefinition resource. An indication is a medical situation for which using the product is appropriate.

map.value: (roll up of all text in Therapeutic Indication.Indication Text, for common case where information is not granular)

short.value: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator

definition.value: The legal status of supply of the medicinal product as classified by the regulator.

description.value: The prescription supply types appropriate to a medicinal product

map.value: Marketing Authorisation.Legal Status of Supply (moved here for practicality)

short.value: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons

definition.value: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to additional monitoring for regulatory reasons, such as heightened reporting requirements.

description.value: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as heightened reporting requirements (e.g. Black Triangle Monitoring).

short.value: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons

definition.value: Whether the Medicinal Product is subject to special measures for regulatory reasons, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorisation studies.

description.value: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as a requirement to conduct post-authorisation studies.

short.value: If authorised for use in children

definition.value: If authorised for use in children, or infants, neonates etc.

description.value: Suitability for age groups, in particular children.

short.value: Allows the product to be classified by various systems

definition.value: Allows the product to be classified by various systems, commonly WHO ATC.

description.value: This value set includes codes from the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System - provided as an exemplar value set.

short.value: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorization

definition.value: Marketing status of the medicinal product, in contrast to marketing authorization. This refers to the product being actually 'on the market' as opposed to being allowed to be on the market (which is an authorization).

short.value: Package type for the product

definition.value: Package type for the product. See also the PackagedProductDefinition resource.

description.value: Types of medicinal product packs

short.value: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources

definition.value: The ingredients of this medicinal product - when not detailed in other resources. This is only needed if the ingredients are not specified by incoming references from the Ingredient resource, or indirectly via incoming AdministrableProductDefinition, PackagedProductDefinition or ManufacturedItemDefinition references. In cases where those levels of detail are not used, the ingredients may be specified directly here as codes.

description.value: This value set includes all substance codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

map.value: Medicinal Product.Ingredient (see also FHIR Ingredient resource)

short.value: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance, or an excipient in the drug product

definition.value: Any component of the drug product which is not the chemical entity defined as the drug substance, or an excipient in the drug product. This includes process-related impurities and contaminants, product-related impurities including degradation products.

description.value: This value set includes all substance codes from SNOMED CT - provided as an exemplar value set.

short.value: Additional documentation about the medicinal product

definition.value: Additional information or supporting documentation about the medicinal product.

short.value: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File)

definition.value: A master file for the medicinal product (e.g. Pharmacovigilance System Master File). Drug master files (DMFs) are documents submitted to regulatory agencies to provide confidential detailed information about facilities, processes or articles used in the manufacturing, processing, packaging and storing of drug products.

short.value: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization

definition.value: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

short.value: Allows the contact to be classified, for example QPPV, Pharmacovigilance Enquiry Information

definition.value: Allows the contact to be classified, for example QPPV, Pharmacovigilance Enquiry Information.

description.value: Extra measures defined for a Medicinal Product, such as heightened reporting requirements.

short.value: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization

definition.value: A product specific contact, person (in a role), or an organization.

short.value: Clinical trials or studies that this product is involved in

definition.value: Clinical trials or studies that this product is involved in.

short.value: A code that this product is known by, within some formal terminology

definition.value: A code that this product is known by, usually within some formal terminology, perhaps assigned by a third party (i.e. not the manufacturer or regulator). Products (types of medications) tend to be known by identifiers during development and within regulatory process. However when they are prescribed they tend to be identified by codes. The same product may be have multiple codes, applied to it by multiple organizations.

description.value: A coded concept that defines the type of a medication.

short.value: The product's name, including full name and possibly coded parts

definition.value: The product's name, including full name and possibly coded parts.

short.value: The full product name

definition.value: The full product name.

short.value: Type of product name, such as rINN, BAN, Proprietary, Non-Proprietary

definition.value: Type of product name, such as rINN, BAN, Proprietary, Non-Proprietary.

description.value: Type of a name for a Medicinal Product.

short.value: Coding words or phrases of the name

definition.value: Coding words or phrases of the name.

map.value: (any and all of the name parts e.g. Medicinal Product Name.Formulation Part)

short.value: A fragment of a product name

definition.value: A fragment of a product name.

map.value: (text of any of the name parts e.g. Medicinal Product Name.Formulation Part)

short.value: Identifying type for this part of the name (e.g. strength part)

definition.value: Identifying type for this part of the name (e.g. strength part).

description.value: Type of part of a name for a Medicinal Product.

map.value: (which of the name parts this is e.g. Formulation Part)

short.value: Country and jurisdiction where the name applies

definition.value: Country and jurisdiction where the name applies, and associated language.

short.value: Country code for where this name applies

definition.value: Country code for where this name applies.
